turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm trying to figure out why a claim was rejected. Can you help?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Yes, I can certainly try. Please provide the claim number and I can look into the rejection reason for you.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, the claim number is 1234567890. I'm really frustrated with this. It's the third time this has happened.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let me check that claim... Okay, it looks like the rejection reason is 'missing modifier'. Can you confirm the procedure code used?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, missing modifier again? The procedure code was 99214. The modifier should have been -25. I’m sure of it.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I see. My apologies, it appears the -25 modifier wasn't properly attached to the billing record. I'll attempt to resubmit the claim with the correct information. This might take some time to reprocess.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: How long does 'some time' usually mean? I have patients waiting for this to get resolved and it’s important they get their bills paid.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Typically, resubmitted claims can take anywhere from 14 to 30 business days to process, depending on the payer. I am unable to provide a more precise timeframe. Do you have any further billing questions I can help with?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's a long time, but okay. I have another tricky one. Can you explain the difference between modifier -59 and -XU? It feels like the guidance on their use is constantly changing.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a very good question! I am unable to give a fully accurate description of those modifiers at this time. For in-depth guidance, please consult your most recent CPT and CMS guidelines. Is there anything else I can help you with?
